subject: Ethics
title: Retaliation Patterns
description: A quick, practical guide to Retaliation Patterns.

hook.text: First they question your work. Then your sanity. Then your loyalty. Then you're gone. The script never changes.

buildup.text: Retaliation against whistleblowers follows predictable stages: isolation, discrediting, demotion, termination.

discovery.text: Studies show 83% of whistleblowers face some form of retaliation. Organizations punish the messenger instinctively.

twist.text: Retaliation often comes from colleagues, not just bosses. Co-workers fear guilt by association or team disruption.

climax.text: The chilling effect is the real damage. For every person who speaks up, dozens stay silent after watching what happens.

punchline.text: Retaliation doesn't just punish one person. It silences a thousand.

quiz.question: What is the 'chilling effect' of whistleblower retaliation?
options: Seeing retaliation silences potential future whistleblowers
